prompt: Write a poem about your favorite food. Focus on taste, smell, and texture.
Imagine you are the wind—what do you see, touch, or whisper as you travel?
Describe a rainy afternoon from the perspective of the raindrops.
Which face shows how you feel today? Why?
Which "weather" describes your mood?
Was your day fast, slow, or did something stop you?
Which subject/activity was your favorite today?
Did you solve a puzzle, unlock an idea, or get a new lightbulb moment?
Did you feel proud, strong, or thoughtful in class today?
Who did you connect or talk with today?
Did someone make you feel loved, upset, or happy?
Did you give or receive kindness today?
If you could live in a story today, would it be magical, heroic, or futuristic?
Where would you teleport if you could go anywhere?
If you had one wish today, what would it be?
Did you achieve something, grow in some way, or hit a challenge?
Did you help someone, work with someone, or set a goal today?
What would you repeat, improve, or celebrate about today?
What kind of "weather" is in your heart today?
Which one matches your energy right now: fiery, frozen, or flowing?
Did something lift you up, focus you, or shake you today?
What reflection, door, or path appeared for you this week?
What new thought or conversation opened your mind today?
Did you unpack, discover, or create something surprising?
Which stage are you in right now — just planted, growing, or strong and steady?
Are you building, climbing, or celebrating something?
What piece of your story changed or fit better today?
What kind of magic would you create if you could?
If you found a secret portal, where would it lead?
What happens when past, play, and fantasy collide?
Fantasy & Adventure: wizard/sword/dragon/crown
Fantasy: unicorn/forest/sparkles/key
Fantasy: princess/clock/crystal ball/owl
Travel: rocket/planet/alien/galaxy
Travel: ship/island/map/parrot
Travel: train/mountain/forest/house
Mystery: detective/magnifying glass/key/door
Mystery: scroll/briefcase/puzzle/clock
Mystery: bat/full moon/haunted house/ghost
Animals: monkey/banana/palm tree/ocean
Animals: wolf/snow/forest/mountain
Animals: butterfly/sunflower/rain/rainbow
Sci-Fi: robot/lightning/satellite/earth
Sci-Fi: astronaut/rocket/moon/alien
Sci-Fi: DNA/microscope/germ/star
Everyday twist: backpack/lightning/speech bubble/eyes
Everyday twist: phone/spiral/door/robot
Everyday twist: pizza/guitar/theater/superhero
Fantasy & Magic: candle/scroll/dragon/moon
Fantasy & Magic: fox/forest/elf/gem
Fantasy & Magic: wand/clock/door/compass
Adventure & Sci-Fi: UFO/volcano/planet/robot arm
Adventure & Sci-Fi: satellite/headphones/black hole/brain
Adventure & Sci-Fi: DNA/rainbow/alien/explosion
Write about a moment when you realized you were stronger than you thought.
If your thoughts had colors, what would today's look like?
What does "home" mean to you, beyond just a place?
What's something small that made a big difference in your week?
When do you feel most alive, and why?
If you could give advice to your future self, what would it be?
What's one thing you wish people understood about you?
Describe a place that always calms you down — even if it's imaginary.
What is a rule you once followed that you now question?
How has your definition of "success" changed over time?
When was the last time you surprised yourself?
Who in your life deserves a thank-you letter you've never written?
When was the last time you felt truly listened to?
What does kindness look like in action — not just in words?
What's something you could do this week that would make someone else smile?
What challenge are you currently facing that might actually be teaching you something?
Describe a time when persistence paid off.
What's one habit you'd like to grow and why?
How do you handle moments when things don't go your way?
Write about a person who inspires your courage.
What does progress feel like — not look like?
If you could pause time for one hour, what would you do?
Imagine trading dreams with someone for one night — what happens?
The stars start rearranging themselves — what message do they spell?
Write your day as if it were a movie trailer.
Invent a new holiday and describe how people celebrate it.
If your emotions had a soundtrack, what song would be playing right now?
Describe your life as if you were a character in a fantasy world.
Imagine a conversation between two objects in your room.
You open a book and fall into its world. What happens first?
Write a story from the perspective of your shadow.
A forgotten smell suddenly brings back a memory you didn't know you had.
Imagine a world where emotions have physical colors. What does yours look like today?
Every mirror in the world starts showing a different reflection — what does yours show?
You find a letter addressed to you from 100 years in the future. What does it say?
The stars blink in a new pattern — what are they trying to tell humanity?
Write from the viewpoint of something small (a bug, a pebble, a raindrop).
If a stranger could read one page of your life, which moment would you show?
What would kindness sound like if it had a voice?
You have a remote that can rewind time, but only by 10 minutes. You can use it once a day. How do you use it today?
If you could send one text message to any person in history, what would you say?
You are burying a time capsule to be opened in 100 years. You can only put inside: one song, one news article, and one object. What are they?
If you woke up tomorrow as a 70-year-old version of yourself, what is the first thing you would check or ask?
Pick a villain from a movie or book. Write a paragraph explaining why they might actually be the hero (or at least misunderstood).
If you could un-invent one piece of technology, what would it be and why?
Write a story about a hero whose superpower is totally useless. How do they save the day anyway?
Describe a situation where telling a lie is better than telling the truth.
If you could change one rule at this school -- not to make it easier, but to make it fairer -- what would it be?
Describe a room that someone just left in a hurry. What clues did they leave behind?
Try to describe the color Red to someone who has been blind their whole life. You cannot use the words "fire," "blood," or "apple."
Write a dialogue between two people arguing over something incredibly silly, but treat it like a life-or-death situation.
If your life right now was a movie scene, what song is playing in the background? Explain why.
List 3 people you would want on your zombie apocalypse survival team. Assign each a role and explain why.
List 5 things you never, ever want to do.
If you could have dinner with one fictional character, one historical figure, and one celebrity, who are the three?
If you were King/Queen of the World for a day, what three minor annoyances would you make illegal?
Draw a random squiggle. Turn it into a recognizable object, then write 3 sentences about what that object is doing.
Take a page from an old magazine. Black out almost all the words, leaving only 5-10 visible that form a poem or sentence.
This object was used as a weapon in a mystery. Who used it and why?
"The unexamined life is not worth living."
writing_prompt: Do you agree? What does it mean to "examine" your life?

prompt: "Know thyself."
writing_prompt: How well do you know yourself? What's something you've recently learned about who you are?

prompt: "Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate."
writing_prompt: What habits or patterns do you follow without thinking?

prompt: "What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us."
writing_prompt: What quality inside you are you most proud of?

prompt: "We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act but a habit."
writing_prompt: What habit defines you?

prompt: "He who has a why to live can bear almost any how."
writing_prompt: What is your "why"?

prompt: "Man is not worried by real problems so much as by his imagined anxieties about real problems."
writing_prompt: Write about a time you worried more than you needed to.

prompt: "In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity."
writing_prompt: Describe a difficulty that turned into an opportunity.

prompt: "Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point."
writing_prompt: When have you shown courage?

prompt: "When we are no longer able to change a situation, we are challenged to change ourselves."
writing_prompt: Describe a situation you cannot change. How can you adapt?

prompt: "Do not act as if you were going to live ten thousand years. Death hangs over you. While you live, while it is in your power, be good."
writing_prompt: If today were your last day, what would you do differently?

prompt: "We are what we think. All that we are arises with our thoughts."
writing_prompt: What thoughts have shaped who you are today?

prompt: "The meaning of life is to find your gift; the purpose of life is to give it away."
writing_prompt: What is your gift?

prompt: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter."
writing_prompt: What do you refuse to stay silent about?

prompt: "Love is patient, love is kind."
writing_prompt: What does love look like in your daily life?

prompt: "We shape our tools and thereafter our tools shape us."
writing_prompt: How has technology shaped who you are?

prompt: "We don't see things as they are, we see them as we are."
writing_prompt: How might your perspective be different from someone else's?

prompt: "The first principle is that you must not fool yourself—and you are the easiest person to fool."
writing_prompt: When have you been fooled by your own assumptions?

prompt: "Attention is the beginning of devotion."
writing_prompt: What do you pay the most attention to? What does that say about you?

prompt: "To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment."
writing_prompt: In what ways does the world try to change who you are?

prompt: "What is a friend? A single soul dwelling in two bodies."
writing_prompt: Describe a friendship that changed you.

prompt: "How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives."
writing_prompt: How did you spend today? Are you okay with that?

prompt: "What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make."
writing_prompt: What kind of difference do you want to make?

prompt: "We suffer more often in imagination than in reality."
writing_prompt: Write about a time you worried about something that turned out to be no big deal.

prompt: "If you are the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room."
writing_prompt: Do you agree? Is it better to be the leader, or the one learning?

prompt: "Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity."
writing_prompt: Do you believe in "luck," or do people make their own luck?

prompt: "Comparison is the thief of joy."
writing_prompt: In the age of social media, is it possible to stop comparing ourselves to others?

prompt: "To study and not think is a waste. To think and not study is dangerous."
writing_prompt: Do you think more or study more? Which matters more?

prompt: "Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance."
writing_prompt: What's something you recently realized you didn't know?

prompt: "The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones."
writing_prompt: What "mountain" are you working on moving? What small steps can you take?

prompt: "What you do not want done to yourself, do not do to others."
writing_prompt: When have you broken or followed this rule?

prompt: "It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop."
writing_prompt: Where in your life do you need to keep going, even slowly?

prompt: "The journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step."
writing_prompt: What journey are you at the beginning of?

prompt: "Knowing others is intelligence; knowing yourself is true wisdom."
writing_prompt: What's the hardest thing about knowing yourself?

prompt: "Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power."
writing_prompt: What part of yourself do you struggle to master?

prompt: "Water is the softest thing, yet it can penetrate mountains and earth."
writing_prompt: When has being "soft" or patient actually been more powerful than force?

prompt: "Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak."
writing_prompt: When have you hidden your true strength or weakness? Why?

prompt: "The supreme art of war is to subdue the enemy without fighting."
writing_prompt: Describe a conflict you resolved without fighting.

prompt: "If you know the enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles."
writing_prompt: What does it mean to truly "know" yourself and your challenges?

prompt: "In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity."
writing_prompt: When has chaos led to something good in your life?

prompt: "I know that I am intelligent, because I know that I know nothing."
writing_prompt: Is admitting ignorance a sign of intelligence? Why or why not?

prompt: "Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because they have to say something."
writing_prompt: When should you speak up, and when should you stay quiet?

prompt: "We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of the light."
writing_prompt: What "light" (truth) are people afraid of today?

prompt: "You have power over your mind — not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength."
writing_prompt: What events are you trying to control that are actually outside your power?

prompt: "The best revenge is to be unlike him who performed the injury."
writing_prompt: How do you respond when someone wrongs you?

prompt: "It is not that we have a short time to live, but that we waste a lot of it."
writing_prompt: How do you waste time? What would you change?

prompt: "It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows."
writing_prompt: What topic have you avoided learning more about because you thought you already knew enough?

prompt: "Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them."
writing_prompt: Can you change how you see a problem you're facing right now?
